greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Zsigmondy numbers for a = 4, b = 1: Zs(n, 4, 1) is the greatest divisor of 4^n - 1^n (A024036) that is relatively prime to 4^m - 1^m for all positive integers m < n.
comment: By Zsigmondy's theorem, the n-th Zsigmondy number for bases a and b is not 1 except in the three cases (1) a = 2, b = 1, n = 1, (2) a = 2, b = 1, n = 6, (3) n = 2 and a+b is a power of 2.
link: K. Zsigmondy, Zur Theorie der Potenzreste, Monatshefte für Mathematik und Physik, 3 (1892) 265-284.
results.author: _Jens Voß_, Sep 04 2001
ext: Corrected and extended by _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 05 2001
